comments:
My eclipse configuration is : SDK 3.1.1, emf_sdo_xsd_2.1.1, GEF_3.1.1, VE_runtime 1.1.0.1, WTP1.0_RC4.
When using the "Create Web Service Wizard" on a project which reference another project. On a project, such as a trivial single project, the wizard is OK.

This bug was already submitted inside BUG 104993, but under the same top level message, there is two different exceptions, and two different bugs.

The wizard generate the following exception :
IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

Kathy, please have a look - Thanks.

The work arround is to create inside the project a new source folder linked to the source directory of the external project and to include the exported library of the external project inside the current project.

Now the project doesn't reference an external project and the web service wizard run perfectly well.

Hi Michel,

I tried creating a Java project and a Web project, then using the Web project's properties menu to add the Java project as the J2EE Module Dependency of the Web project.  I have no problem creating the Web service from a Java file in the Web project that refers to classes in the Java project.  The Axis emitters were called successfully, the WSDL file and WSDDs were generated.

Could you please include the exact steps you created the utility project and associate it with the Web project?

After many tries, I think I found where the problem is located.
My project (lets call it 'A') where I want to create a wev service refrence an other projet (lets call it 'B') that contanins many utility classes.
Many other projects (C, D, E, F, ...) reference too the same project 'B'.
As soon as one of the C,D, E, F do not contain the following line inside the <natures> item of .project, I get the error :
		<nature>org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature</nature>
Many of these projects were created before I install the WTP plug-in. So they do not contain this line.
I hope you will be able to reproduce the problem.

Happy new year to all...
Michel

Michel, thanks for the detail description!  

I was able to reproduce the problem and fixed it.  I'm attaching the CVS code patch and a JAR for you to try on WTP 1.0.  Just back up the old JAR and verify that the problem you encountered is fixed by this new JAR.  Thanks!

The patch had been committed and released in v20060106_1712.  The fix will be in the WTP 1.0.1 mantenance build the week of 01/09.

Created an attachment (id=32625)
JAR for axis.consumption.ui.

Created an attachment (id=32626)
CVS code patch for axis.consumption.ui

Many thanks Kathy!
Everything is now OK.

Fixes is contained in WTP 1.0.1 M build M200601102004:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/M-M200601102004-200601102004/
*** Bug 124475 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Verified on WTP 1.0.1 candidate 0217_1228 on behalf of the reporter.

Closing defect.
